.. py:exception:: MessageFailure

   Bases: :py:obj:`Exception`


   Common base class for all non-exit exceptions.


.. py:function:: add_message(request, level, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)

   Attempt to add a message to the request using the 'messages' app.


.. py:function:: get_messages(request)

   Return the message storage on the request if it exists, otherwise return
   an empty list.


.. py:function:: get_level(request)

   Return the minimum level of messages to be recorded.

   The default level is the ``MESSAGE_LEVEL`` setting. If this is not found,
   use the ``INFO`` level.


.. py:function:: set_level(request, level)

   Set the minimum level of messages to be recorded, and return ``True`` if
   the level was recorded successfully.

   If set to ``None``, use the default level (see the get_level() function).


.. py:function:: debug(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)

   Add a message with the ``DEBUG`` level.

   Add a message with the ``SUCCESS`` level.


.. py:function:: warning(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)

.. py:function:: error(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False)
